thread.title: Lafayette's Walker Wood commits to UK
thread.title_full: Lafayette's Walker Wood commits to UK

title: Lafayette's Walker Wood commits to UK
text:
/ Headlines List / Article 
LEXINGTON, Ky. (WKYT) Lafayette quarterback Walker Wood announced he staying in Lexington and will for the Wildcats. The University of Kentucky making that announcement prior to the game with Auburn. 
Wood received a scholarship offer from Mark Stoops within the last week and he will join fellow General offensive lineman Landon Young at UK. 
Wood also had offers from Louisville and Cincinnati 
Wood is rated as a 3-star quarterback, but his offer from Kentucky labels him as an “athlete”, which means he is capable of playing numerous spots on the field. 
In eight games this season, Wood has led the Generals to a 6-2 record while passing for more than 12-hundred yards with 12 touchdowns. He is just as dangerous on the ground with 90 carries for 877 yards and ten touchdowns. 
Wood, who also had a scholarship offer from Louisville, is UK’s fifth commitment for the class of 2017, joining quarterback Mac Jones, running back Michael Warren, defensive end James Hudson and athlete Russ Yeast. 
One of Wood’s high school teammates is five-star offensive tackle Jedrick Wills, who has emerged as UK’s top recruiting target in the class of 2017. Wills also attended Thursday night’s UK-Auburn game.
